critique: This document is a short executive order regarding the reinstatement of a specific individual, Mrs. Jessie Scott Arnold, to a classified position in the Federal Trade Commission. It cites the Civil Service Act as its authority. Given the limited scope and specific nature of the order, it's difficult to assign strong biases along most of the axes. The order itself doesn't touch on ideological issues, immigration, executive power in a broad sense, federalism, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion in any meaningful way. The fact that it is an executive order does not automatically mean it expands executive power. It is simply a specific action authorized by existing law. The recommendation by the Federal Trade Commission suggests some level of internal review and agreement, further mitigating any strong claims of unilateral executive action. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral.
